best_review:
The condition of the first WHEN clause is modified to include an additional check on the last element of 'parts'. The second WHEN clause remains unchanged as before.

```sql
CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION public.get_file_type(filename text)
 RETURNS character varying
 LANGUAGE plpgsql
AS $function$
DECLARE
    parts text[] := string_to_array(filename, '.');
BEGIN
    IF cardinality(parts) > 2 THEN
        -- If the last element of 'parts' is 'gz', return 'gzip'. Otherwise, return 'other'.
        RETURN CASE WHEN lower(element_at(parts, -1)) = 'gz' THEN 'gzip' ELSE 'other' END;
    ELSIF cardinality(parts) >= 2 THEN
        -- If the last element of 'parts' is not 'gz', return 'plain'. Otherwise, return 'other'.
        RETURN CASE WHEN lower(element_at(parts, -1)) != 'gz' THEN 'plain' ELSE 'other' END;
    ELSE
        -- If the array has only one element, return 'other'.
        RETURN 'other';
    END IF;
END;
$function$
```
